config.question: The signing of the North Atlantic Treaty was a historic event in the conduct of foreign affairs by the American government because it marked __________.

choices.content: the end of European fears of Russian military aggression
a departure from the traditional U.S. policy of isolation
the end of the attitude of distrust by European powers
a replacement of the policy of domination with equal status

answer_3.response: Consider This: The United States committed itself to the defense of Europe in a key clause in the NATO treaty. The NATO alliance escalated the Cold War. Whatever its advantage in building a sense of security among Europeans, it represented an overreaction to the Soviet danger. See L.O. 28.2 Containment.
